notesStmt.note: Several pages pages partially stained. Lacunae after folios 7, 19, 29, 32, 33, 40, 50, 60, 70, 106, 134.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary on the book of Numbers (fragments).

collation.p: Fragments of three different groups of quires, originally of 10 leaves each. Signatures in Hebrew letters and Arabic numerals on the upper margin of the first page of a quire (partially preserved). Imperfect at hte beginning and at the end, with lacunae throughout.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script of the 16 and 17th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Samuel Ha-Rofe. Comm. On Numbers. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2490.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [143v] .
